result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Sirek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Allowed to serve on home monitor if he qualifies. 
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs.
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
No contact with Bryan Kaufman.
Participate in any other assessment or counseling as recommended.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  At discretion of agent to accept prior AODA assessment and sign releases that will allow the agent to monitor and check compliance.
*Pay restitution as determined after a restitution hearing, joint and several with Justin Zblewski if he is convicted.

timeConds.notes:
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve on Home Monitoring if he qualifies for the program after being assessed by the sheriff's department. 
Allowed to set up the time to start through his probation agent, at times consistent to his ability to work, if can reasonably be done in the next 6 months, otherwise to be served within that time.

records.addlTxt: Restitution Hearing Findings of Fact, Conclusions of Law and Judgment /s/ DJW 03/03/16 and TBE 03/07/16
Unsigned restitution hearing findings, correspondence, amended restitution summary, referral to court commissioner for restitution hearing.

Attorney Anne Renc in court.  Defendant does not appear.   Victim Witness Coordinator, Jane Iwanski appeared for the State of Wisconsin, along with Bryan Kaufman.
10:59 a.m.   Restitution Hearing scheduled at this time.  Court calls case, and states appearances.  Atty Renc states with the Defendant not appearing, she is not sure if he is still contesting the Restitution.  Atty Renc states Restitution was Joint and Several with another Defendant on another case.  Atty Renc states they will not contest the restitution.

BTC:  Court will recommend restitution in the amount of $11,266.39, joint and several with co-defendant Justin Zblewski.

Concludes at 11:02 a.m.
Restitution hearing at 02-29-2016 11:00 am

Defendant Joshua J Sirek in court with attorney Anne Renc. Victim Witness Assistant Holly Mrozinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:33:25 am. Court calls case.
Atty Renc requests the Court for an adjournment due to last minute documents received and needing to do some research on it.
Court allows the matter to be adjourned.

Concluded 10:37:45  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 11:00 am.
letter from FCC to Atty Anne Renc, Atty David Knaapen and Victim Witness Coordinator dated 01/14/16 informing of restitution hearing
DNA Proof of Submission - already on file
**Amended (joint & several)
Referral to Court Commissioner for Restitution Hearing /s/ TBE 01/08/16

Defendant Joshua J Sirek in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF17, 15CF256, 15CF321

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
State files amended information in 14CF17 which amends Count 1, 15CF256 amending the single count and 15CF321 amending Count 1. 
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.  Will be requesting a restitution hearing.
Atty Renc received copies of the amended informations in each file and waives their readings. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF17 (amended) Count 1 - NO CONTEST
14CF17 Count 2 - NO CONTEST

Atty Knaapen indicates that Count 1 would be as Party to the Crime, but is not reflected on the amended information in 14CF17.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF256 (amended) Count 1 - NO CONTEST
15CF321 (amended) Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Atty Renc makes statements re: the facts. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF17 Counts 1 & 2, 15CF256 Count 1, 15CF321 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF321 Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court.  They are requesting a restitution hearing in 14CF17.
Atty Knaapen makes additional statements to the Court. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.

BY THE COURT:
14CF17 
180 days jail - STAYED -
Allowed to serve on home monitor if he qualifies. 
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Placed on probation for 24 months:
Serve 30 days jail. 
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve on Home Monitoring if he qualifies for that program after being assessed by the sheriff's department. 
Allowed to set up the time to start through his probation, at times consistent to his ability to work, if can reasonably be done in the next 6 months, otherwise to be served within that time.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  At discretion of agent to accept prior AODA assessment and sign releases that will allow the agent to monitor and check compliance. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Maintain fulltime employment. 
Participate in any other assessment or counseling as recommended.
No contact with Bryan Kaufman. 
Pay restitution as determined after a restitution hearing, joint and several with Justin Zblewski if he is convicted. 
Pay costs. 

Atty Renc makes statements re: ADOA on an OWI case. 

14CF17 Count 2 - 
150 days jail, concurrent with Count 1, - STAYED -
Allowed to serve on home monitor if he qualifies.
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Placed on probation for 24 months: 
Same conditions, except for the jail, as in Count 1. 

15CF256 - 
30 days jail, concurrent, - STAYED -
Allowed to serve on home monitor if he qualifies.
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Placed on probation for 24 months: 
Same conditions, except for the jail, as in 14CF17. 
Pay costs. 
Provide DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge. 

15CF321 Count 1 - 
30 days jail, consecutive to any jail sentence in 14CF17 & 15CF256, - STAYED -
Allowed to serve on home monitor if he qualifies.
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Placed on probation for 24 months, concurrent with 14CF17 & 15CF256:
Same conditions, excluding the jail condition, as in 14CF17.
Pay costs and pay the DNA surcharge. 
Provide DNA sample.  

Court orders a restitution hearing.  Order is printed and provided to the parties.

Court calls case at 10:47 a.m. Defendant Joshua J Sirek in court with attorney Anne J Renc. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Renc request bond modification of conditions on case 14CF17 - Day Report reduction.  State objects.
Atty Renc - Permit to miss day report on days when he is work and to provide proof of same work on those days.  Heavy Crane operator employment.

BTC:   Sig bond Amended in 14CF17: Excused from Day Report and Groups on those day report that he is working and provide document to the Pretrial supervision program.

$2,000 sig bond:   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.  No contact with Bryan Kaufman. Comply with bond conditions in other pending cases including 13CT54.

No further witnesses.

4:06 p.m. Atty Renc makes final statements.
